node.title: Rain pummels east coast, swelling rivers, wiping out crops
node.alt: flood waters cover the photo, with only tall trees and what is left of tin shed poking above the water.
node.description: Hopes of a bumper harvest are dashed in parts of New South Wales as rain continues, flooding towns and leaving farmers feeling anxious.
node.content:
["Parts of the east coast are getting drenched, with flood warnings in Queensland, NSW, and Victoria.", "Close to 60mm fell overnight at Byron Bay, Coonamble and Gunnedah while Dubbo recorded 66mm and\u00a0Wagga Wagga received the highest total in NSW with 70mm of rain.", "Cessnock, Richmond, Bathurst, Tuggeranong, Cooma and\u00a0Coonabarabran all recorded nearly 50mm overnight.", "In Queensland, more than 100mm was recorded in Bundaberg, around 80mm fell at Gladstone and Palmerville while\u00a070mm fell at Cooktown, and 60mm on the Gold Coast.", "Bowen, Hervey Bay and\u00a0Nambour recorded close to 50mm.", "A rain station at Combienbar in East Gippsland, Victoria\u00a0recorded that state's highest total, with nearly 55mm falling overnight.", "
Grain concerns
", "Heavy rains have delayed harvest in parts of NSW and Victoria, which could see crops either downgraded from food-grade to animal feed or destroyed if they get too wet.", "In the NSW Western Plains region,\u00a0Scott Empringham from Nevertire felt thankful he was able to get his crop harvested prior to the deluge.", "\"I was fortunate to get the crop off before this hit of rain,\" Mr Empringham said.", "\"We pulled the truck into the shed last Friday afternoon before the rains started, so,\u00a0touch wood,\u00a0I've had a good run.\"", "But\u00a0others have not been as lucky. Near Moree, where 38\u201345mm fell overnight, grain grower Oscar Pearse said the harvest was on hold.", "Mr Pearse faced\u00a0yield losses of between 10 to 100 per cent on his crops and estimated\u00a0the downgraded quality could see income reduced by up to 70 per cent this season.", "For the crop that had\u00a0been harvested, he was spending more than $80,000 on temporary storage.", "\"This was supposed to be a recovery year after a major two-and-a-half-year drought,\" he said.", "\"We've now, during the 2021 harvest period, received more than double the total rainfall we did for the whole 2019 growing season.\"", "
Cherries hit
", "Early varieties of cherries have been seriously affected by moisture in some key growing regions, including northern Victoria and southern NSW.", "\"There are some regions that have tried to pick as much as they can, but the amount they've been able to pack has been a lot lower than they would have liked,\" Young grower Tom Eastlake said.", "\"And there are other areas where growers have just walked away from early varieties and are hoping the others will be better.\"", "Mr\u00a0Eastlake said the weekend brought a nervous wait\u00a0with forecasts of more rain.", "
Swollen rivers
", "Water continues to rush into storages across the Murray-Darling Basin, as Hume Dam approaches 100 per cent capacity.", "The Murray-Darling Basin Authority increased its daily release of water from the dam from 21.5Gl\u00a0to 30Gl\u00a0per day on Thursday.", "\"Current releases are not expected to exceed the minor flood level in the Murray River at Albury for now, however higher releases over the next 24 to 48 hours may result in flows above minor flood level,\" it said in a statement.", "The Murray, Murrumbidgee, Lachlan, Gwydir, Namoi, and Macquarie Rivers all have flood warnings in place."]
